title: 114_s3417
content: The Act is titled the "Receiving Electronic Statements To Improve Retiree Earnings Act" and it involves electronic communication of pension plan information under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Act allows pension plan documents to be furnished electronically if the system ensures effective access for participants through direct delivery or online posting. The Act allows electronic furnishing of pension plan documents to participants, beneficiaries, or individuals with proper notice and the option to select specific electronic means for document delivery. The Act allows electronic delivery of pension plan documents with the option for individuals to choose specific electronic means for document receipt. Personal information confidentiality is protected, and an annual paper notice is provided to describe the chosen electronic delivery method or election. The Act permits electronic delivery of pension plan documents with the option for individuals to select specific electronic means for document receipt. The electronically furnished document must adhere to style, format, and content requirements and include a notice explaining its significance. The Act allows electronic delivery of pension plan documents with specific options for recipients. The table of contents is amended to include a new section after section 111. The Act permits electronic delivery of pension plan information under specific conditions, including effective access for recipients. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow electronic communication of pension plan documents to participants, beneficiaries, or specified individuals. The Act allows electronic delivery of pension plan information to participants, beneficiaries, or individuals through various electronic means to ensure actual receipt of the material. The Act permits individuals to choose electronic means for receiving documents, modify their selection, or opt for paper versions at no extra cost. It also requires an annual notice describing the electronic delivery options. The Act allows individuals to choose electronic delivery of documents, with the option to switch to paper versions at no additional cost. Electronic documents must meet specific formatting requirements and include a notice explaining their significance. The Act allows electronic delivery of documents, including reports, statements, notices, and notifications. Existing methods of document delivery are protected, and additional methods can be prescribed by the Secretaries of Labor and Treasury. The amendments apply to documents furnished for plan years. The Act allows electronic delivery of documents, including reports, statements, notices, and notifications, with new methods prescribed by the Secretaries of Labor and Treasury. These amendments apply to documents furnished for plan years starting after December 31, 2016.
